channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Washington DC leads America in unemployment rate for 3rd straight month
item.description: D.C.'s jobless rate reached 6% in July, a reflection of the mass layoffs of federal workers, and collapsing international tourism.

item.title: The ‘Low Performers’ Layoff Scandal Still Stings at Meta. Here’s What You Can Learn From It
item.description: A by-the-numbers approach to job cuts and employee evaluations upended managers’ jobs at the tech giant.

item.title: Many Employees Want AI Making Management Decisions, a New Survey Says
item.description: A study finds a majority of participants think AI would make more objective choices than human bosses.

item.title: ‘This isn’t about free speech. I’m sure they’re gonna holler that’: Minnesota sues TikTok, accusing it of preying on the young
item.description: The lawsuit, filed in state court, alleges that TikTok is violating Minnesota laws against deceptive trade practices and consumer fraud.

item.title: Sony to raise PlayStation 5 prices in the U.S. amid tariff uncertainty
item.description: Sony will raise prices of its PlayStation 5 consoles in the United States by around $50 from Thursday, as the Japanese conglomerate navigates a slow r...

item.title: So You Want to Be a LinkedIn Influencer?
Brands Keep Releasing Controversial Campaigns. What’s Behind the Rise in Risky Marketing?
item.description: Brands including Swatch, American Eagle, and E.l.f. faced recent backlash for advertisements that consumers said crossed a line.

item.title: TSA adds new items to the banned list — and they might be in your bathroom

item.title: Why the NFL drafted Microsoft’s gen AI for the league’s next big play
item.description: The NFL and Microsoft announced a new multiyear partnership extension that includes the deployment of 2,500 Microsoft Surface Copilot+ PCs.

item.title: Sony will pass on tariff costs to U.S. consumers by hiking Playstation 5 prices
item.description: The PlayStation 5 is currently the most popular gaming console in America.

item.title: Is Walmart’s Radioactive Shrimp Actually Dangerous?
item.description: The FDA asked Walmart to recall frozen shrimp over potential radioactive contamination.

item.title: Google’s Pixel 10 phones just got a long-overdue upgrade
item.description: Google’s latest Pixel 10 phones, which were just announced today, don’t come with many external physical changes. The most tangible hardware addition ...

item.title: OpenAI’s chairman says ChatGPT is ‘obviating’ his own job—and says AI is like an ‘Iron Man suit’ for workers
item.description: Bret Taylor says computer programmers like himself may face an existential crisis.

item.title: Trump calls on Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook to resign over alleged mortgage fraud

item.title: What you can do about the government data that’s disappearing

item.title: Stocks open mostly lower as investors digest retail earnings — live updates
